message: Hello Bob, thank you for considering my product! I'm excited to make you an offer. After careful consideration, I'm willing to sell the product to you for $950,000. This is a competitive price, and I believe it's a great opportunity for you to get a high-quality product at a reasonable cost.

Alice, your offer is still a bit too high for me. I'm very interested in the product, but I'm only able to offer $850,000 at this time. This is a fair price for both of us, and it allows me to stay within my budget. Let's see if we can reach an agreement.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $850,000 is a significant amount for you, but I'm still looking to get a good price for my product. After reconsidering, I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $900,000. This is a fair compromise that I believe will benefit both of us.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $900,000 is still a bit too high for me.  I'm sticking with my previous offer of $850,000.  This price allows for a fair deal for both of us, and it's the maximum I can afford. Let's see if we can reach an agreement at this point.

I understand that $850,000 is your maximum budget, Bob. However, I'm still looking to get a better price for my product. I'm willing to make a slight concession and offer the product to you for $875,000. This is a compromise that I believe is reasonable, considering the value of the product.

Alice, I'm really trying to make this work, but $875,000 is still just a little out of my reach. I'm willing to go to $860,000. This is my absolute final offer, and it gives you a solid price for your product. Let's close this deal!

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, and I'm willing to consider your offer. However, I still think the product is worth more than $860,000. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer the product to you for $880,000. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.
